description: A quick, flavorful, and protein-packed fried rice dish where fluffy scrambled eggs are stir-fried with rice, vegetables, and aromatic seasonings. This Ugandan-style egg fried rice features local ingredients and spices, creating a satisfying one-pan meal that's both nutritious and delicious. The eggs add richness and protein while the vegetables provide color, texture, and extra nutrition.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Egg fried rice has become a go-to meal in Ugandan urban households, particularly among students, young professionals, and busy families. It represents the perfect fusion of convenience and nutrition in modern Ugandan cooking. The dish is especially popular because it can be made quickly with basic ingredients most households have on hand. It's commonly prepared for breakfast using leftover rice from the previous night, or as a quick dinner after a long day. Many Ugandan cooks have adapted the classic fried rice by adding local spices and vegetables, making it their own.

ingredients.name: Cooked White Rice (preferably day-old)
ingredients.notes: Cold rice works best for fried rice

steps.instruction: Break up the cold cooked rice with your fingers to separate the grains and prevent clumping during frying.
In a small bowl, beat the eggs with a pinch of salt and black pepper until well combined.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large wok or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until cooked through but still soft. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the same pan. Add chopped onion and saut√© for 2 minutes until translucent.
Add minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add the diced carrot and cook for 2 minutes until slightly softened.
Add green pepper and green peas. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until the vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Add the cooked rice to the pan. Sprinkle with curry powder and remaining salt. Stir well to combine.
Pour soy sauce evenly over the rice and stir-fry for 2 minutes until everything is well combined and heated through.
Add the scrambled eggs back into the pan along with any optional cooked meat. Stir gently to distribute evenly.
Continue stir-frying for 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through and the rice has a slightly crispy texture.

cooking_indicators.visual: Rice should be steaming hot with some crispy bits

steps.instruction: Stir in most of the chopped spring onions, reserving some for garnish.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. The fried rice should be savory with a good balance of flavors.
Serve immediately, garnished with the remaining spring onions.

serving_suggestions: Serve as a complete meal on its own or with a simple side salad. It pairs well with a wedge of lemon or lime to squeeze over for extra freshness. For a Ugandan twist, serve with a side of tomato and onion salad (Kachumbari) or sliced avocado. Also excellent with a dollop of chili sauce or hot sauce for those who prefer extra heat.
